item.title: UK Domains and Web Hosting
item.description:
Network Solutions, a leading provider of domain registration and web hosting, offers a wide range of services tailored for users in the United Kingdom. These services extend beyond .co.uk domain names to include web hosting, email hosting for businesses, SSL certificates, and design and marketing solutions, catering to both UK-focused and global businesses. ](http://www.tkqlhce.com/click-1726600-10868378) While .uk is the UK’s designated country code top-level domain (ccTLD), registering a .uk domain differs from registering a ...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/uk-domains-and-web-hosting/

item.title: Transformation of the third pillar: The conclusion of the transition period for EU criminal and policing law
item.description:
by Emilio De Capitani On December 1st, 2014, after five years, the prior “third pillar” of EU law will transition from intergovernmental control to a supranational system. However, it remains unclear if this shift will result in a consistent policy that is properly executed by Member States and respects human rights. Specifically, according to Article 10 of Protocol 36, added by the Lisbon Treaty, all EU measures concerning police and judicial cooperation in criminal matters adopted before the Lisbon Treaty will be treated like other EU laws regarding the jurisdiction of the Court of Justice of the European Union (CJEU)...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/transformation-of-the-third-pillar-the-conclusion-of-the-transition-period-for-eu-criminal-and-policing-law/

item.title: The impact of the Rwanda Policy on the Common Travel Area in a low trust context with high trust arrangements.
item.description:
Professor Colin Murray, University of Newcastle, and Professor Steve Peers, Royal Holloway University of London Photo credit: Zairon, via [Wikimedia Commons](Photo credit: Zairon, via Wikimedia Commons ) Introduction Recent disagreements between the UK and Ireland concerning the ramifications of the UK’s Rwanda asylum policy highlight the complex interplay between EU law and Common Travel Area (CTA) agreements that now govern immigration policies between the two nations. This analysis examines these interactions and the Irish Government’s legislative proposals following the Irish High Court’s decision in A v Minister for Justice...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-impact-of-the-rwanda-policy-on-the-common-travel-area-in-a-low-trust-context-with-high-trust-arrangements/

item.title: The draft adequacy decisions: Data Protection in the UK and the EU
item.description:
Lorna Woods, Professor of Internet Law, University of Essex Background The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and the Law Enforcement Directive (LED) have strict rules about transferring personal data outside the EU. Adequacy decisions are the simplest way to ensure these transfers are safe. Currently, twelve countries have received full or partial adequacy decisions, including Japan, which has additional safeguards in place. The US previously held an adequacy status, but the Court of Justice overturned this in the Schrems II case...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-draft-adequacy-decisions-data-protection-in-the-uk-and-the-eu/

item.title: The UK is now part of the Schengen Information System, bringing the Panopticon Home.
item.description:
Steve Peers The idea of a “Panopticon,” a prison where guards could potentially see any inmate at any point, was conceived over two centuries ago by British philosopher Jeremy Bentham. He believed that the constant threat of observation would motivate prisoners to act appropriately. This concept is now often used to illustrate contemporary patterns in widespread monitoring and societal control. The European Union’s (EU) initial move in this direction was the establishment of the Schengen Information System (SIS) during the 1990s...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-uk-is-now-part-of-the-schengen-information-system-bringing-the-panopticon-home/
